metadata.title: CVE-2014-7931 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
factory.cc in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code thattriggers improper maintenance of backing-store pointers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
